endpoints.name: 1. Create Quote
endpoints.description: **Note**: profile ID used in this call will define whether transfer is made on behalf of the person or business.

endpoints.name: 2. GET balance recipient ID
endpoints.description:
Get a list of multi currency account balances.
Note the **recipientId** field value from the response.

endpoints.name: 3. Generate GUID for idempotency
endpoints.description: You don't have to use an API for this - you can almost certainly do it in code. This is just for testing convenience.

endpoints.name: 4. Create topup order
endpoints.description: A transfer is a payment order to recipient account based on a quote. Once created, a transfer needs to be funded within the next five working days. Otherwise, it will be automatically canceled.

endpoints.name: 5. Get payin deposit details for top-up
2. Update form if any field require refresh
1. Update quote with selected recipient
endpoints.description:
Set the recipient the user wishes to send to on the quote to get an updated price and delivery estimte.

ENSURE `Content-Type` IS `application/merge-patch+json` ELSE THIS WILL FAIL

endpoints.name: 2. Get transfer extra info dynamic form
3. Update transfer extra info dynamic form (if any fields require refresh)
4. Generate GUID for idempotency
endpoints.description: You don't have to use an API for this - you can almost certainly do it in code. This is just for testing convenience.

endpoints.name: 5. Create transfer (standard flow)
endpoints.description: A transfer is a payment order to recipient account based on a quote. Once created, a transfer needs to be funded within the next five working days. Otherwise, it will be automatically canceled.

endpoints.name: 1. Fund transfer
endpoints.description:
The only way to fund your transfers via API is to fund them from balance.
Note that based on the user origin this call might be the subject for SCA, more details in [API Documentation](https://api-docs.wise.com/#strong-customer-authentication)
